data.title: Ferdinand II of Portugal
data.text:
King of Portugal (jure uxoris) from 1837 to 1853Template:SHORTDESC:King of Portugal (jure uxoris) from 1837 to 1853

Dom Ferdinand II (Portuguese: Fernando II) (29 October 1816 – 15 December 1885) was a German prince of the House of Saxe-Coburg and Gotha-Koháry, and King of Portugal jure uxoris as the husband of Queen Maria II.

First marriage[edit]

On 1 January 1836, he married Queen Maria II of Portugal in Lisbon.

Issue[edit]

Pedro V of Portugal (16 September 1837 – 11 November 1861) married Stephanie of Hohenzollern-Sigmaringen but had no issue.

Luís I of Portugal (31 October 1838 – 19 October 1889) married Princess Maria Pia of Savoy and had issue.

Infanta Infanta Maria of Portugal (4 October 1840)

Infante João, Duke of Beja (16 March 1842 – 27 December 1861) never married.

Infanta Maria Ana of Portugal (21 August 1843 – 5 February 1884) married Prince Georg of Saxony and had issue.

Infanta Antónia of Portugal (17 February 1845 – 27 December 1913) married Leopold, Prince of Hohenzollern and had issue.

Infante Fernando of Portugal (23 July 1846 – 6 November 1861) never married.

Infante Augusto, Duke of Coimbra (4 November 1847 – 26 September 1889) never married.

Infante Leopoldo of Portugal (7 May 1849)

Infanta Maria of Portugal (3 February 1851)

Infante Eugénio of Portugal (15 November 1853)

Second marriage[edit]

n 10 June 1869 to actress Elisa Hensler (Neuchâtel, 22 May 1836 – Lisbon, Coração de Jesus, 21 May 1929). Prior the marriage, she was styled Gräfin (Countess) von Edla by Ferdinand's cousin Ernest II, Duke of Saxe-Coburg and Gotha. The couple had no issue.

Titles and styles[edit]

October 29, 1816 – November 12, 1826 His Serene Highness Prince Ferdinand of Saxe-Coburg-Saalfeld, Duke of Saxony.

November 12, 1826 – January 1, 1836 His Serene Highness Prince Ferdinand of Saxe-Coburg and Gotha, Duke of Saxony.

January 1, 1836 – September 16, 1837 His Royal Highness The Prince Consort.

September 16, 1837 – November 15, 1853 His Most Faithful Majesty The King.

November 15, 1853 – December 15, 1885 His Most Faithful Majesty King Dom Fernando II"
